critique: This document primarily concerns the security and governance of the Canal Zone during a declared emergency. It clarifies the chain of command between the military commander and the civilian governor, giving precedence to the military's views on matters of military security. It also establishes an appeal process to the President. There's no explicit ideological tilt, immigration stance, or focus on social inclusion. The document centralizes authority during an emergency, expanding executive power to some extent, and prioritizing security. It has a slight impact on federalism by clarifying the chain of command.
